qas.question: What is a condition that can cause symptoms of astham in children?
What are some other causes of airway obstruction?

answers.text: foreign body aspiration, tracheal stenosis or laryngotracheomalacia, vascular rings, enlarged lymph nodes or neck masses

qas.question: What other conditions can cause wheezing?
In adults, what conditions can cause the symptoms of asthma?

answers.text: COPD, congestive heart failure, airway masses, as well as drug-induced coughing due to ACE inhibitors

qas.question: What can cause symptoms of COPD in children?

plausible_answers.text: foreign body aspiration, tracheal stenosis or laryngotracheomalacia, vascular rings, enlarged lymph nodes or neck masses

qas.question: What are other causes of sinusitis?
What do COPD and congestive heart failure also produce?
How many conditions can cause symptoms of congestive heart failure?
What kind of dysfunction can be seen only in adults with COPD?

context: <b7_0>Many<b7_0/> other conditions can cause symptoms similar to those of asthma. In children, other upper airway diseases such as <a0_0><b4_0>allergic rhinitis and sinusitis<b4_0/><a0_0/> should be considered as well as other causes of airway obstruction including: <a1_0><b5_0>foreign body aspiration, tracheal stenosis or laryngotracheomalacia, vascular rings, enlarged lymph nodes or neck masses<b5_0/><a1_0/>. <a2_0>Bronchiolitis and other viral infections<a2_0/> may also produce <b6_0>wheezing<b6_0/>. In adults, <a3_0>COPD, congestive heart failure, airway masses, as well as drug-induced coughing due to ACE inhibitors<a3_0/> should be considered. In both populations <b8_0>vocal cord dysfunction<b8_0/> may present similarly.
